DOC.brief_summary: This study determine biological response different dosage neck mobilization intervention patient , provide opportunity identify optimal dosage , predictor response , outcome measure well longitudinal change biology . Subjects acute whiplash associate disorder ( WAD ) II III symptom duration le 30 day ( acute ) 30 90 day ( subacute ) randomly assign receive different dos mobilization . The dosage treatment group differ number session ( 1 , 2 3 time per week ) duration treatment ( duration treatment intervention 3 , 6 , 12 week ) . A zero treatment/week option include insure impact mobilization include previous study suggest single mobilization may treatment effect . All patient participant receive core standard treatment education , advice stay active , neck/postural stretch strengthen exercise . All patient participant receive supervise exercise advice full 12 week . All patient provide instructional CD exercise brochure reinforce whole program . Follow-up assessment consist quantitative sensory testing ( vibration threshold ; current perception threshold ) , Neck Walk Index ( NWI ) , Upper Cyclical Reach Grasp Task , muscle biology analysis ( cytokine analysis ) , central breathe control test ( capnography ) , range motion , head flexion endurance , self-report symptom disability ( Visual Analogue Scale ; Neck Disability Index ; Disabilities Arm , Shoulder , Hand ; pain threshold tolerance algometry ; perceive self-efficacy ; SF-36 ) . Hypothesis : During recovery , patient expect transition acute painful state one resume normal activity add intensive strengthening exercise .
